intro: Erucastrum incanum var. hirtum, commonly known as the hairy bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically lobed and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The hairy bladderpod is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
